intro: Alsophila scabriuscula var. guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan tree fern, is a species native to Central America. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, feather-like fronds. The plant has a slow growth rate and can reach heights of up to 10 meters in optimal conditions. Its rhizome is robust, and it thrives in humid, shaded environments with well-drained soil. The fronds are typically dark green and have a rough, textured surface.
